official-title.#text:
To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to
		  require corporations and labor organizations to disclose to their shareholders
		  or members the amounts disbursed for certain political activity, and for other
		  purposes.

header.#text:

Title
			 III of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971

header.#text:
Disclosures by
				Corporations and Labor Organizations to Shareholders and Members of Information
				on Disbursements for Certain Political Activity

Including
				information in regular periodic reports

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
with respect to the disbursements made by the corporation or
				labor organization for covered political activity during the period covered by
				the report, but only if the amount of the disbursement made for such activity
				during the period covered by the report equals or exceeds the applicable
				threshold for the activity described in

text.#text:
A corporation which
				submits regular, periodic reports to its shareholders and a labor organization
				which submits regular, periodic reports to its members shall include in each
				such report, in a clear and conspicuous manner, the information described in

The information described in this paragraph is, for
				each disbursement for covered political activity—

the date of the
				disbursement;

the amount of the
				disbursement;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the name of the
				candidate identified in the independent expenditure or electioneering
				communication involved, the Commission ID assigned to the candidate, and the
				office sought by the candidate; and

text.#text:
in the case of a disbursement consisting of
				an independent expenditure or an electioneering communication, or in the case
				of a covered political activity described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the identification
				of the association or organization to whom the disbursement was made, and the
				Commission ID (if any) assigned to the association or organization.

in the case of a
				covered political activity described in

If a corporation or labor organization includes
				information in a report pursuant to this section, at the time the corporation
				or labor organization submits the report to its shareholders or members, the
				corporation or labor organization shall file a statement with the Commission
				consisting of the information included in the report pursuant to this
				section.

If a
				corporation or labor organization maintains an Internet site, the corporation
				or labor organization shall post on such Internet site a hyperlink from its
				homepage to the location on the Internet site of the Commission which contains

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
not later than 24 hours after
				the Commission posts the statement filed by the corporation or labor
				organization under

on the Internet site of the Commission, and
				shall ensure that the hyperlink remains on the Internet site of the corporation
				or labor organization until the expiration of the 1-year period which begins on
				the date of the election with respect to which the disbursements included in
				the statement are made.

If any provision of this Act or amendment
			 made by this Act, or the application of a provision or amendment to any person
			 or circumstance, is held to be unconstitutional, the remainder of this Act and
			 amendments made by this Act, and the application of the provisions and
			 amendment to any person or circumstance, shall not be affected by the
			 holding.
